dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, crypto's been, uh, quite the rollercoaster lately, hasn't it? I mean, Bitcoin, Ethereum, they've both seen some pretty wild swings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, crypto's been, uh, quite the rollercoaster lately, hasn't it? I mean, Bitcoin, Ethereum, they've both seen some pretty wild swings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bitcoin price has lost almost 50% of its value since hitting its all-time high of nearly $65,000 per bitcoin in April. Meanwhile, ethereum is down by more than half after climbing to over $4,000 per ether token earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. And speaking of which, there's this, like, leaked J.P. Morgan report that's got everyone talking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. And speaking of which, there's this, like, leaked J P Morgan report that's got everyone talking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, a leaked report from Wall Street giant Goldman Sachs GS +1.8% has given ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency with a market capitalization of around $250 billion compared to bitcoin's $660 billion, a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? J.P. Morgan weighing in, huh? What's the, uh, what's the big takeaway from that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? J P Morgan weighing in, huh? What's the, uh, what's the big takeaway from that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're basically saying Bitcoin has a high chance of overtaking Ethereum as the dominant store of value. They even called Bitcoin "the Amazon of information," which is pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're basically saying Bitcoin has a high chance of overtaking Ethereum as the dominant store of value. They even called Bitcoin the Amazon of information, which is pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given the importance of real uses in determining the store of value, ether has a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value, analysts at Goldman Sachs wrote, according to leaked sections of the report shared on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] "The Amazon of information"? Wow. I mean, usually you hear Ethereum getting all the credit for innovation and use cases. What's their rationale there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Amazon of information? Wow. I mean, usually you hear Ethereum getting all the credit for innovation and use cases. What's their rationale there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I thought the same. But according to these analysts, it's all about "real uses" determining value. They're pointing to, uh, decentralized finance – or DeFi – and NFTs.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given the importance of real uses in determining the store of value, ether has a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value... The soaring popularity of so-called decentralized finance... Non-fungible tokens... have added another use case.

dialogue_turns.text: DeFi and NFTs? But I thought most of that was built on Ethereum's network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the interesting part. The report claims that *most* DeFi apps and NFTs are actually being built on the Bitcoin network, and that NFTs are often purchased using Bitcoin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the interesting part. The report claims that most D E F I apps and N F Ts are actually being built on the Bitcoin network, and that N F Ts are often purchased using Bitcoin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most decentralized finance (DeFi) applications are being built on the ethereum network, and most non-fungible tokens (NFTs) issued are purchased using ether.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. That's, uh, a pretty bold claim. I mean, we've certainly seen Bitcoin's price performance. It was up like 1000% over the last year compared to Ethereum's 300%.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the last 12 months, the ethereum price has far outpaced the bitcoin price, with ethereum adding around 1,000% compared to bitcoin's 300%, even when the last week's price crash is taken into account.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And even with the recent crash, they're saying the long-term development for Bitcoin isn't affected. Plus, there are those long-awaited upgrades for Bitcoin, you know, to help it scale and reduce transaction costs.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, some think long-awaited upgrades to ethereum, begun at the end of last year and designed to help ethereum scale and reduce its sky-high transaction costs, could help the ether price reach never-before-seen heights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the scaling solutions. So they're betting on those to really push Bitcoin ahead?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the scaling solutions. So they're betting on those to really push Bitcoin ahead?

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, big time. And there's this quote from Kosala Hemachandra, CEO of MyEtherWallet, who said Bitcoin isn't just a value token; it actually fuels all use cases on its blockchain.
